subject: Business
title: SWOT Analysis: Strengths to Threats
description: A micro-lesson that makes SWOT Analysis: Strengths to Threats usable.

hook.text: A CEO asks: 'What are we good at?' and 'What could kill us?' That's SWOT in two questions.

buildup.text: SWOT maps Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats into a simple 2x2 grid.

discovery.text: Strengths and weaknesses are internal. Opportunities and threats come from outside â€” markets, competitors, trends.

twist.text: The tool is so simple that people misuse it. Listing 40 items per quadrant makes it useless.

climax.text: The real value: use SWOT to drive action. Match strengths to opportunities. Defend weaknesses against threats.

punchline.text: A SWOT that doesn't change your next decision was a waste of time.

quiz.question: What makes a SWOT analysis actually useful?
options: Using it to drive specific strategic decisions
Listing as many items as possible per quadrant
